intro: Phacelia bolanderi, commonly known as Bolander's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky habitats, such as cliffs and talus slopes, in California and Nevada. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms from spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
